wikipedia_page.main: Kathleen Bever Blackburn,  (1892–1968) was a British botanist best remembered for the 1923 discovery that plant cells have sex chromosomes. Her principal contributions were in plant cytology and genetics. She was also a pioneer of pollen analysis.: 49  She taught botany at Armstrong College, Durham University (later renamed King's College, now Newcastle University) from 1918 to 1957.: 49
